types.name: GraphQuery
types.description: All information available for reading from the Scout API.

fields.name: app
fields.description: Fetch an app by its ID.

args.name: id
args.description: The app's ID.

fields.name: collectors
fields.description: (Internal) Get a list of active collectors

fields.name: persona
fields.description: Fetch a persona by its ID.

args.name: id
args.description: The Persona ID.

fields.name: player
fields.description: Fetch a player for a given title, by their Persona or System ID.

args.name: title
args.description: The ID/slug of the title the player data is associated with.

args.name: id
args.description: The Persona or System ID of the player.

args.name: segment
args.description: The segment of data you want from the player.

fields.name: playerBulk
fields.description: Fetch players in bulk for a given title, by their Persona or System IDs.

args.name: title
args.description: The ID/slug of the title the players' data is associated with.

args.name: ids
args.description: The list of Persona or System IDs of the players.

args.name: segment
args.description: The segment of data you want from the players.

fields.name: players
fields.description: Search for players based on the specified parameters.

args.name: identifier
args.description: (Required or use 'identifiers') The identifier of the player (handle, Player ID, Persona ID, external platform ID, etc.)

args.name: identifiers
args.description: (Required) The identifiers of the players (handle, Player ID, Persona ID, external platform ID, etc.)

args.name: platform
args.description: (Optional) The platform (ID/slug) to limit the search to.

args.name: console
args.description: (Optional) The console (slug) to limit the search to.

args.name: title
args.description: (Optional) The title (ID/slug) to limit the search to. Including this field improves the probabilty of the search succeeding.

args.name: exact
args.description: (Optional) Whether or not an exact match on the identifier field is required. (Default: false)

args.name: comprehensive
args.description: (Optional) Whether or not we should perform a comprehensive search for the persona. This involves querying multiple data sources and slows search considerably. Disable for typeahead functionality. (Default: true)

fields.name: raw
fields.description: (Partner access only) Fetch raw data from a title.

args.name: title
args.description: The ID/slug of the title.

args.name: method
args.description: The name of the method in the title client's GetData method.

args.name: parameters
args.description: A list of objects to pass to the method

fields.name: thing
fields.description: Fetch a thing for a given title.

args.name: title
args.description: The ID/slug of the title.

args.name: name
args.description: The name/type of the thing.

args.name: parameters
args.description: A list of objects to pass to the thing.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Fetch a specific title based on the specified parameters.

args.name: identifier
args.description: The ID/slug of the title.

fields.name: titles
fields.description: A list of all the titles supported.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Get a user by their ID.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the user.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: appleIOSAppId
fields.description: Numeric ID created by App Store Connect.

fields.name: blockedAt
fields.description: When the app was blocked from using Scout's services. (null if it is not blocked)

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the app was created.

fields.name: creator
fields.description: The user who created the app.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A short summary detailed the app's intended purpose.

fields.name: enableOAuth2Compatibility
fields.description: Whether the app uses an OAuth 2.0 compatible authorization flow.

fields.name: googleAndroidBundleId
fields.description: The app's bundle identifier.

fields.name: iconUrl
fields.description: A secure (HTTPS) URL to the app's icon.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The app's ID.

fields.name: isBlocked
fields.description: Whether the app was blocked from using Scout's services.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the app.

fields.name: returnUrl
fields.description: The URL an authorizing user will be redirected to after completing the authorization flow for the app.

fields.name: scopes
fields.description: The app's scopes.

fields.name: secret
fields.description: The app's secret key, used for performing secure calls to Scout's API.

fields.name: webUrl
fields.description: The URL where the app or website can be found on the web.

fields.name: apps
fields.description: A list of Scout apps owned by the user.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The user's email.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the user.

fields.name: personas
fields.description: A list of the user's online personas.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: A ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Examples: CA, US, CN, DE

fields.name: externalId
fields.description: The ID of the persona as it exists on the platform.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: The username of the persona as it is displayed on the platform.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the persona.

fields.name: isVerified
fields.description: Whether the persona is verifiably linked to a Scout user.

fields.name: pictureUrl
fields.description: The picture URL for the persona.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: The platform this persona is on.

fields.name: region
fields.description: Continental geographical region, one of: AF, AN, AS, EU, NA, OC, SA

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the platform.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The code-safe name of the platform.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the collector.

fields.name: titleId
fields.description: The ID of the title the collector is collecting for.

fields.name: id
fields.description: System ID of the player.

fields.name: items
fields.description: All items relating to this player segment.

fields.name: matches
fields.description: Recent matches played by the player. Support varies by title.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata related to this player segment.

fields.name: segments
fields.description: Player data segmented into logical pieces. Varies by title.

fields.name: stats
fields.description: All stats relating to the this player segment.

fields.name: segments
fields.description: Item data segmented into logical pieces. Varies by title.

fields.name: items
fields.description: All items relating to this player segment.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata related to this player segment.

fields.name: stats
fields.description: All stats relating to the this player segment.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description for the object.

fields.name: displayValue
fields.description: Pre-formatted/localized value of the object.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The ID/key for the object.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the object

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value of the object.

fields.name: displayPercentile
fields.description: If available, the pre-formatted/localized percentile this statistic's value falls into.

fields.name: displayRank
fields.description: If available, the pre-formatted/localized rank of the statistic.

fields.name: displayValue
fields.description: Pre-formatted/localized value of the statistic.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: The stat's metadata.

fields.name: percentile
fields.description: If available, the percentile this statistic's value falls into.

fields.name: rank
fields.description: If available, the global rank for this statistic's value.

fields.name: rating
fields.description: If available, the rating of this statistic's value.

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value of the statistic

fields.name: description
fields.description: Human friendly description of the stat.

fields.name: iconUrl
fields.description: Where applicable, this will be a fully qualified URL which points to an image representing the statistic.

fields.name: isReversed
fields.description: Whether or not the statistic's value has a reversed importance. (ie. kills vs. deaths)

fields.name: key
fields.description: Key for referencing the statistic in code.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Human friendly name for the stat.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: id
fields.description: System ID of the object.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata related to this player segment.

fields.name: teams
fields.description: The teams that played in the match.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata related to this player segment.

fields.name: players
fields.description: The players that played on the team.

fields.name: stats
fields.description: Match stats for the team.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Metadata related to this player segment.

fields.name: playerId
fields.description: System ID of the player.

fields.name: stats
fields.description: Match stats for the player.

fields.name: results
fields.description: The results list.

fields.name: persona
fields.description: If available, an object representing the associated persona.

fields.name: player
fields.description: If available, an object representing the associated player.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: The username of the player typically as it is displayed in game.

fields.name: playerId
fields.description: System ID of the player. Can ALWAYS be used to fetch stats using the Player API.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title that the player is associated with.

fields.name: boxArtUrl
fields.description: The URL for the title's box art.

fields.name: heroArtUrl
fields.description: The URL for a background to use for the title.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The title ID.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the title.

fields.name: platforms
fields.description: A list of the platforms that are supported by the title.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: The code-safe name for the title.

types.name: GraphMutation
types.description: All methods which can be used to create or update data in the Scout API.

args.name: app
args.description: The app information.

args.name: id
args.description: The app's ID.

args.name: app
args.description: The app information.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: A short summary detailed the app's intended purpose.

inputFields.name: returnUrl
inputFields.description: The URL an authorizing user will be redirected to after completing the authorization flow for the app.

inputFields.name: webUrl
inputFields.description: The URL where the app or website can be found on the web.

inputFields.name: appleIOSAppId
inputFields.description: Numeric ID created by App Store Connect.

inputFields.name: enableOAuth2Compatibility
inputFields.description: Whether the app uses an OAuth 2.0 compatible authorization flow.

args.name: title
args.description: The ID/slug of the title the player data is associated with.

args.name: id
args.description: The Persona or System ID of the player.

args.name: segment
args.description: The segment of data you want from the player.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Date
types.description: The `Date` scalar type represents a timestamp provided in UTC. `Date` expects timestamps to be formatted in accordance with the [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the 'if' argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the 'if' argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
